intro: Csapodya sousae, commonly known as the São Tomé daisy, is a flowering plant native to the island of São Tomé in the Central African Ocean. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar plants. The plant features showy, yellow-orange flower heads with white ray florets, typical of the genus Csapodya. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its restricted range, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
